comment: Rambles on about his life experiences and how he is so great because he was the first in his family to get a college degree, most things he says are irrelevant. Doesn't know how to teach, he reads through the book in class and says such equation/table/example is "important". Tests aren't hard, but be prepared to learn alone at home with the book.

If you are an online only student, you are already screwed. The audio in the BlackBoard Colab is sketchy sometimes, and it seems he wanders around the room making it even more difficult to hear his ramblings. He DOES NOT use ANY of the technology offered in the D2L. No drop box, no deadlines. You will work twice as hard for  half the grade, AVOID!!
If you don't know him and don't do the assignment the way he wants, he probably wouldn't pass you. :

Professor Dollar offers very little help. The project exercises were lost opportunities to learn anything. Tests, were tough. You MUST reed the book, because the test is a sentence out of the book with a word missing. You better be able to remember where you saw that sentence!!

Tends to ramble at times on many tangents but when he does give pertinent information, it can be pretty profound. He is really trying to help students become more in touch with reality. He just sometimes loses them by rambling so they check out during class.

This class is an accounting class, taught by someone who doesn't know anything about accounting. I would take this class with someone else if possible. He is a cool guy outside of class, but as a professor, he is not worth much. Oh yea, he doesn't teach. So you have to teach yourself the whole book, good luck!
Terrible Terrible Professor, he doesn't teach and don't communicate at all. He never even solve a single equation. You will be much better off if you stay away from him.
TERRIBLE TEACHER!! Professor does not teach, expects you to learn on your own by reading the book.. stay away if possible!
Great Teacher! Take his class!!!

Professor Dollar is a great professor, He tells you life stories based on experience on the job. He is very fair with grading, and his test are straight forward. Papers are expected to be grammar error free and he expects you to write at college level. He also give you a chance to correct your mistakes on papers. I would definitely recommend him
Easy but terrible professor.

He likes to talk alot mostly about his personal experience. Tests are easy just study the powerpoints and the definitions. You will have at least three papers to write he is very picky about grammer. Over all the class is a easy A if you can write good papers.
Does share too many personal stories but overall is a fair and helpful teacher. I would recommend taking him.
He definitely likes to talk, most of the time it is irrelevant personal experiences. He's not always clear on instruction or explaining assignments. He's a nice guy, but can be a boring professor.

What a terrible waste of my time. Who really takes attendance in college and bases your grade on it???? Rambles on about his life but not much about the material. Disect the chapters to pass the tests. I would avoid him like the plague!!!!!!!!!!!!! No need to offer your opinion in class either, because it will be wrong!

Class was EXTREMELY boring.  He ran off on tangents constantly and would give you 3 or 4 ?life lessons? per class.  That being said, he is a very fair teacher and there were never surprises on the tests.  He is very knowledgeable and knows his stuff.  His lectures are just SO boring.
The man gave be a B on one assignment because he did not agree with my OPINION! Opinions have no right or wrong answer. I had him for orientation, it was fairly easy and extremely boring!
His self-promotion skills were excellent.    Few people could sell themselves so well.

Nice and helpful professor. Reports and essays are graded strictly, so know your english comp and technical writing. Tests are straight forward. He brings real life situations to the academic setting.

"I worked with the nurses thats why i am so good."  An example of one of his life stories from class.  Don't make fun of him as easy as it is to, because this guy will throw you under the bus at the end of the semester.  The tests are fairly easy, I only studied an hour or so the night before tests and averaged about an 89 on all of them and about
If you like your questions answered with questions this might be the class for you. Classes was a series of HIS life story and had nothing to do with the content of the course.

His course was easy. He encouraged independent study. He wasn't available after class to help with coursework much, though. It was a summer class with restricted office hours. Overall, I liked his teaching style. I am signing up for 3 more of his classes this fall.  He is strict when he grades his tests, but he gives partial credit.  Take him.

Overall his tour papers were difficult, we had to cover to much stuff in his class, unfortunately he is the only professor that teaches this course. He only gives three tests during the semester and you have to study a lot for each. If you miss one day or even if you are late for class he counts as absent.

Teacher did not know how to explain how the book did problems, but would not test over those questions.  Good professor, but very liberal minded.  If liberals make your blood boil, then avoid.  Otherwise you can make a good grade in this class with completing HW and asking POINTED questions.

This guy sucks!  He's an absolute idiot.  Talks about how "great" he is, and how he's the perfect example of an industrial engineer.  He does not teach... ANYTHING.  Class should be called "The history of the Dollar."  yeah I came up with that myself.  Avoid if possible... unfortunately, he's the only one teaching IET Systems and Processes.

This guy talks about everything else except material that we have to cover in the class period. The tests are not very easy. Eventually i had to drop the course because of his teaching ability. You have to teach to yourself
